reviews.text:
Free entry though donation requested. 

The place is gorgeous like all old churches with amazing windows. A big organ and lots of mini chapels inside of the church. There is good history and explanations within the church and their patron saints tomb. Definitely a must see in Glasgow
The young lady at the souvenir shop was incredibly helpful and could be a tour guide. Knowledgeable about the cathedral and area. Cathedral has history and personality.

AMAZING cathedral. Loved it, super cool, gothic cathedral with amazing stained glass windows!! The grounds were nice and Necropolis is right next to it, offering excellent views of the cathedral.  The people working inside were super friendly, a must see in Glasgow!!

Very impressive Glasgow landmark. Beautiful 19th century stained glass windows. Plenty of nooks and crannies and quite atmospheric. Free entry. Signage could be improved, probably best for guided tour although volunteers may also be available. Small shop with some Scotch kitsch. Nearby, necropolis well worth stroll, Museum of Religion lacklustre.
Beautiful cathedral in the heart of Glasgow. Well worth a visit, plus the entry is free! Glasgow Necropolis is next to it, if you climb the hill you get a great view of Glasgow and the cathedral.

What a lovely historic station. Has good visibility for taking photos. Good set of shops. It’s in a good location to serve Glasgow. Has good destinations particularly London. Worth a visit just for the architecture.

Glasgow Central is a very clean and well laid out station with a lot of shops of varying kinds.

There are toilet and showering facilities that are regularly cleaned and usable for a small fee.

The reason for 4 stars is that in the winter it can be bitterly cold.

At first I was a little upset that I had to walk from queen street station to transfer here, but started to look forward to it actually. It’s a beautiful old station with good amenities. 

When I first saw this piano it made me wish I knew how to play.  But today a man was playing and it made me so happy as he went seamlessly from Bowie to Lennon. I could have stayed there for an age.

This a wonderfully centrally located station.
It is currently having some renovation work done but there are still places to grab a snack or drink. There are large digital boards providing updates train information and a staff information booth. The staff was both friendly and knowledgeable.

The Central station in the heart of my favorite scottish city Glasgow. 
Outside it's the classic Victorian-Style building, inside it's a modern style where you can feel a lot of air and space. 
This station provides all the necessary service needed for the tourists and the new-comers.
I had a tour which was just under an hour. Was very cheep, and was definitely worth it

What a waste of public funds painstakingly restoring it. The money could be better spent on I dunno maybe the NHS, food banks, the homeless. I think we should be solving our social and health problems in this country before spending money on nice things for tourists and the rich. Thats the whole problem with Scotland. Were like children. Any money we get we hit the toy shop.

What a great historical building with very knowledgeable and convivial students. The building was designed by the famous architect mackintosh. The building is very beautiful. It would be better if we could see the studios with their huge north windows witch was a shame. Over all great experience would go again sometime. Leave a like please 👍🏻
Incredible facility with many many talented people.
Best wishes to make art
Best way to cross the Clyde, really dry except in the rain. I like how it wobbles with lots of people on. Really makes it feel like I'm living life on the edge. Mad stuff really.
Well traveled footbridge, fairly distinctive but could do with a touch up and a good cleaning
Brightens up a drab area.
Amazing and superb..!! Must visit place in Glasgow.!!
Nice place to sit and have lunch

I graduated from the university of Glasgow with a Doctor of Philosophy degree, I love this place as my second home. I could not learn so much in life without the helps of my supervisors and Professors in the department!

Great place to study. The atmosphere surrounding it is phenomenal. It has a nice blend of old and new architectures and is nicely maintained. I definitely recommend it. It's also got a lot of nice shops and places to eat around it
They take deposits from students before giving an offer! It is too much to ask from students to pay 500 - 1000 pounds before giving an offer! This is pure robbery.
Great place for photos and to check out one of the oldest universities in the world. Great architecture and decor. Very photogenic!

It's not even the half of what they advertise. Tutors and lecturers have their own problems and they won't be bothered with you. You do not get replies from them and you end up submitting assignments without having any replies back! There are better choices in Glasgow if you want quality in your studies.

What a fabulous experience ... the actress Lesley Robertson acting as Miss James today gave a stellar performance as to what school days would have been like back in 1939. I cannot recommend this visit enough.

It's good but could be better if they included a couple of rooms with a brief history of all Glasgow schools and former schools.  Would tap in to nostalgia for locals, increase visitor numbers.  It lost some points because there was a hot wheel on it.
So informative! If your ever in Scotland I would recommend going! It's very interactive
Loved it and so did my 9 year old daughter, Malcom the guide had great knowledge, good banter, truly an asset to this museum. Really was a great day out.

Great place to go and visit. I went for the CRM Architecture and the amazing stairwell windows. The displays of schooling in Scotland through the ages are well presented. Lovely friendly and helpful staff too.

My very first visit to Holmwood House. Having lived on it's doorstep for around 40 years I decided to see for myself what it had to offer , I was not disappointed .
Owned by the National Trust for Scotland , my first impression was , what took me so long to visit such an interesting place. 
What made it such a good visit was the staff , from the minute I walked in the door I was very warmly welcomed by Jean who took the time in giving me a description of the House and the family behind it , it was very obvious she took great pleasure and pride in her role. 
During my visit I also met and spent time with Louise and Jim,  the manager of Holmwood House who were welcoming,   informative,  knowledgeable and most importantly,  friendly. 
I would highly recommend a visit to Holmwood House and I will certainly make return visits.
Loved some of the architecture. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. Probably go back another time when the craft fayre isn't on for a better look round.

So interesting I fell asleep! I love anything to do with mediums and ghost hunting but the supposed medium acted as a historian telling us the history of the place, no messages for anyone there and God only knows what the side kick was there for.
They brought out a paper angel board and some toy lights that are set off by proximity. And asked the toy lights questions! For £50 I kinda expected a little more you know. Of your thinking of going I'd advise you to spend your money on a real medium. I would've given it zero stars if I could've.
Pity as I was looking forward to it.
We only went to the cafe but it was excellent - we sat outside in the back with the dog and had a lovely cup of tea and a scone.

I was really looking forward to the ghost hunt and at £50 per ticket I expected a bit more than a "medium" who acted as a historian but not a medium, and his side kick. A paper angel  "board" (tempted to write bored, so bored I fell asleep, I kid you not) and some toy lights that light up if there proximity is triggered were brought out. Other than the historian, sorry medium telling us about the history, that was that. Not worth a tenner never mind £50 quid. I wouldnt waste your time. I'd spend the money on a real medium. The thing is, I love anything to do with ghost hunting so to get such a bad rating from me (woulda been 0 if it let you) it would have to be really rubbish unless I slept through the good part.
Have visited in past. An excellent museum but currently closed for renovation.
Still being refurbished! Taking so long to do. Hopefully worth the wait x
Well worth a visit even if you don't walk around the park. Which I highly recommend. Free to visit, donations welcome. Cafe reasonably priced. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Well worth a visit and don't miss the walk around the park. . Cafe reasonably priced. Staff are friendly and helpful. free as most museums in glasgow are.
take your time and enjoy!!
First time going there even though I was born here it was quite a good experience learning new things about what happend in Scotland and the history rich history

Absolutely brilliant we arrived at 11am and apart from a half hour lunch break it was non stop until nearly 4pm. Cant fault the place. Fantastic for children and so much interactive fun. Cafe was great and soup and a sandwich was tasty and well priced. Definitely be back when in the area.

Great Day out with the kids, unfortunately a whole afternoon wasn't enough time to get around a fully enjoy all the exhibits! If we lived closer I would definitely sign up for the annual passport pass.

The sit down cafe is definitely worth a mention and the prices are great too! (PS try the freshly made pizzas)

This is a great place for all ages and abilities. Their accessibility is the best in the city and every staff member has been excellent in ensuring a friendly and helpful visit. Love love love! I’m a support worker and I’ve brought everyone here. And if you’re going a few times it is WELL worth the annual pass. ❤️❤️❤️

I would recommend this Science Centre strongly for all ages, all interests and anyone looking for fun mixed with wonder. My learning disabled son and I spent several hours exploring, experimenting, and being wonderfully entertained. Every single member of staff from reception, cafe, shop and exhibits were helpful, informative and super kind. We want to go back again and again. Thank you.

This place is fantastic! So many interactive and engaging displays and activities for kids of all ages and with plenty to entertain adults too! Every single exhibit can be touched, encouraging people to pull, push, poke, prod, turn, roll etc etc. Definitely worth coming here. A great way to spend a day.

Love this museum. Last time we saw dippy was London.  dippy looking good. Nice to see other parts of the country being able to see this. Great family day. Plenty for children to see and do. 
        Shop good as prices for kiddies things not too bad,  for use of  pocket money to spend. Good to see. Love visiting here.

The building is simply stunning and worth a visit without even considering what is available on the inside. Its a nice walk along Argyle Street (west of Glasgow central). There are several shops, pub and restaurants along the walk. The building is free to enter, so I don't mind paying a little more for the food on offer (basic tea/coffee, sarnies and cakes). The entrance as you (hopefully) can tell from the attachment, is huge! There are several rooms leading from this central grand hall. Each room provides a collection of artifacts surrounding a similar theme. Animals, dinosaurs, beautiful sculptures of the mythological and historical. Art from Rembrandt and Dali (did nothing for me). A history of swords and armour. The Sunday (not sure if its done other days) we went there was an organist who played for a hour. Quite ethereal as it echoed around the building. We didn't rush by any means and had a cuppa at one point and we were there for three hours.

Wonderful to see a Dali, Mary Cassatt and learn more about Scottish history, ancient through modern, in this beautiful building. Reminded me of the V&A in London on a smaller scale. I was in Glasgow for work and was able to enjoy a quick 2 hour look around and take in some wonderful art and surroundings. As it was free entry there's open access to all and no reason not to visit. 10 minutes from closest subway and on lovely grounds next to the university of Glasgow. Don't miss it if you enjoy a little art fix followed by a nice walk in the park.

Absolutely fabulous gallery. Wonderful collections, something for every one. Fantastic building too, set in nice area by river. Sometimes has organ recitals with HUGE church type organ with seats put out. Lovely cafe.

One of Scotland's national treasures and I've been visiting this wonderful place for around 45 years!
It used to inspire me as a child and still succeeds in doing the same to this day! A much-loved icon of Glasgow which offers free admission to all. If you haven't been you really must check it out! Great visitor facilities throughout!

This is a great place to visit. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Theres a short video when you go in that is worth stopping and watching too. I look forward to popping back in the summer and seeing the herb garden in its full glory.
Was great stepping back in time to see how folk lived. Well preserved.

Oldest house in Glasgow. We used to pass it every day for years thinking it was something for the tourists but it's not. Tells you a lot about Glasgow and the people who helped shape it. Not just the house and its furniture but the garden at the back. Even though it's at a busy intersection it is very peaceful inside. Best to go late in the day as it's normally quieter.

Provand's Lordship is a historic house museum and said to be the oldest house in Glasgow and of medieval origin. There's some pre-printed notes describing the house and it's history, though you'll have to get it yourself as the staff don't mention it.

The ground and first have been through a restoration, so contains furnishing to reflect the assumed state. The ground floor has an interesting short documentary about the house and the first has been set up with what the room might have looked like in the days of Canon Cuthbert Simson, 500 years ago. Both the furnishing and restoration are good quality. The second floor is mostly an exhibition of Scottish art related to Glasgow.

The gardens are also very nice and set up like one of the uses of gardens centuries ago, as a place to go herbs with medicinal properties. Don't miss the Tontine Heads in the gardens!
Amazing little place, so much history in one little house, well worth a visit and it's free to get in.

Cafe on board and very informative. On the ships lower deck there is a kids play area, so it's good for all the family. Also right next to the transport museum, I loved it here and would recommend and even go again myself, I have already been twice with different people.

This is an wonderful place for individuals of all ages. The ship is much larger than it may initially may appear. There is a wonderful cafe on board. The majority of the boat is handicapped accessible. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. The Admission is free for this museum which makes it a very affordable day out.

The Glenlee is a great example of a tall ship. The ship is well preserved and is an excellent floating museum. Great exhibits of the history of the ship are very interesting and well presented. The ship has a good cafeteria that is reasonably priced.Some if the stairways are a bit steep as you would expect on an old ship, care is required if you have children with you. Well worth a visit.

Well worth a visit with the exhibitions taking you back into past periods. Bus service from Glasgow city centre takes you the front door. Large car park if you drive there. Right on the banks of the River Clyde. There is a cafe on site.

The Tall Ship at the Glasgow Harbour is a must place to see when you visit Glasgow. The ship is anchored at the front of the museum and it is free to entry. You'll see the cabins that used to be used by the officers, the ship's engine, her galley, etc. You can also book a wedding to be held onboard this ship!

As the name of the museum suggests, the museum is very much focused on religious life and art. I half expected the focus to be on Christian art, but there example of art from all the world's major religions and well as less well known ones, including those from antiquity.

There's also a good sized cafe at the selling food and drinks at very reasonable prices by museum standards. The museum is absolutely worth visiting.

I stumbled upon this museum after leaving the Glasgow Cathedral and what a wonderful surprise it was. You enter after walking by a Zen garden. It is much larger than it appears and is staffed by a lovely group of individuals. Admission is free, represents a wide selection of religions and has some good children’s activities. The view from the top floor is spectacular and a wonderful place to take a photo or two.
The main exhibition hasn't changed much. The zen garden has fallen into disrepair. More faiths could be included. But it's great it exists. Something everyone should visit at least once.
Beautiful cathedral, was interesting from a tourist standpoint while still remaining very spiritual and religious. Had lots of things to see as well as quiet areas for prayer.

I was so surprised by this place. Didn't expect this place to be that beautiful. Very interesting to learn about all the differences between the religions around the world. Enjoyed my visit very much. Thank you!

So interesting to see. Evoked some memories as I lived in a tenement myself. Less fancy though! It's so well preserved A tribute to the National Trust. The custodian was great, very well informed. A great couple of hours spent.

A great musuem. Incredibly helpful friendly and knowledgeable staff brought the place to life.
Quite a lot of 'I remember this as a kid'
 Very worthwhile hour 
Went with our local hosts who hadn't been before but said they will definitely be back
This is a wonder trip back in time. Talk to the people now looking after this wonderful house and experience this woman's home and history. A MUST do.
Great to see tenement in near original state. Was great to see some features from this original tenement that were retained in the one I lived in.

Fascinating history of actual people who lived there, in depth knowledge from the guides who brought it all to life with all questions answered and more! Great experience - well worth the visit, Paul and Tracey

Great open spaces very clean park and right next to art galleries and west end bars shops and restaurants! Great for a day out with all you need close by too within walking distance. Great views of the city.

One of my favourite destinations in Glasgow. Beware there are no streetlights at night time but in my opinion  this adds to the charm and magic. Also a lot of famous landmarks here. This is also a great destination for players of Pokemon  Go, especially during community days. You can feel a buzz in the air.

This spectacular west end garden is one of the most beautiful city centre I have ever visited. The Kibble Palace in particular is worth the trip alone. If you're visiting Glasgow, check it out, you won't be disappointed!!

A nice little park that's good for a wander. It's very expansive so you can spend a good while just walking and taking in the sights of the river, the monuments and statues. It's very picturesque on a summers day.
There's also the museum nearby, which makes the park a very nice day out.
Very busy on school off days. But plenty space to share. Lot's of nice tree and plants. Kids play area. Skate park. Dog friendly too.

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics

Walked our dog on pleasant woodland walk. Early Spring so contents of walled garden not up to what they would be later in the year. Didn't take dog into garden as per rules but others did! Stupid rule anyway. Nice cafe good service and food plus dog friendly!
Love visiting here. A varied selection of walks. Today saw/bought plants & had a coffee. The staff are delightful and helpful.
Lovely tranquil garden even at this time of the year.  I intend to visit regularly to see the changes throughout the year.
Hidden gem! Explore the beautiful garden and woodland then enjoy the lovely cafe with seated courtyard area where you can buy good quality seasonal plants.

This was my first visit to Greenback to which I had been taken for lunch. I have to say that the food was amazing. In addition, I had a wander around the shop attached and was amazed at the prices. Normally Garden Centres are expensive, but not so with Greenbank! The prices in the shop were very, very reasonable to the extent that coupled with the quality and standard of their food, I would have no hesitation in visiting again when I am in the area.
If you are into engineering you will appreciate the view

A superb example of the world class engineering and industry that Clydebank could justifiably boast about. It's sad that so little remains of those heady days, but it's worth a visit to get a feel for the range and scale of activities that contributed to putting the "great" into great Britain.

The crane itself stands tall in memory of the clydes history with ship building.
It was the world's first electrically powered cantilever crane.

A few years ago I decided to throw myself off the crane for fun. Had an awesome time.

There's a lot of Construction work round about this large crane in what used to be John Brown's Shipyard in Clydebank . I worked here several times, the last time in the late 90s and certainly this crane was working then and certainly it still looks in some sort of working order . Of course this is a monument to Clydebanks shipbuilding heritage, it built the Queen Mary and the Queen Elizabeths, a proud past indeed.
Sited within the old John Brown's Shipyard, it offers great views from the top of the surrounding area.

This bar diner ticks all of the boxes. Outside-the-box decor, comfortable seating, excellent friendly staff, interesting views of Merchant City Glasgow. There's always good music playing and the selection of drinks is large and reasonably priced. The food is all veggie, therefore I can't personally comment but I know from friends that it's of superb quality. Major acts appear here in the evenings. WELL worth a visit - 10 out of 10!

Was looking for a vegetarian restaurant for a friend visiting Glasgow for the first time.
Glad we went here. Authentic Glasgow feel with good food. Not pretentious like some of the vegetarian places we went to.
Good service, Fair prices and specials keep things interesting.
Really good venue for bands, downstairs in 13th note. Great sound and atmosphere.  Saw The Art Revival in there. Brilliant young band. Check them out on YouTube.

Pop in now and then for some great food.
Very nice and chilled out place. Great menu. I have never been disappointed. Think I'll go in this weekend!
Love this place... great vibes, drinks and food! All the staff are great too

Visited this place 3 times while in Glasgow and can’t wait to go back. Entirely vegan menu and gluten free options also available. The vegan mince and tatties is a must. Great selection of beverages. Place can get very busy so try booking in advance. Super friendly staff.

What's not to like about Stereo? Great atmosphere and good surroundings. Can get quite busy at the weekends so can be difficult to find a seat but when you can it's really nice to chill here with your friends. 

They also serve food. It's a vegan bar / restaurant and the food is surprisingly good. It's impressive what they can make with vegan ingredients and the best thing is that it's guilt free!

Amazing food, friendly and helpful staff and a really relaxed and not too formal atmosphere.  Recommend for lunch, dinner and drinks! Actually... Don't go! Or I won't be able to get a table next time!!
Instant bloom was excellent. The bar staff was second to none. Keep it up 👆 ☺
Great Place! Good selection of Beers and Ales. Food Looks Good as well. *5
The place is friendly and cozy and the staff is very nice. I went just once, but loved it. The "stand up man" was brilliant too. Absolutely worth visiting for a pleasant evening.

Lived in Woodlands for around 15 years and have been so lucky to have this on my door step. I'm a semi regular and can thoroughly recommend it for a good night out. £3 Tuesday's are always good for a laugh, can be a bit hit and miss but if seen some belters at it over the years!
Just been there for the first time and have no words. Cozy space and good comedians. If you haven't been already you need to give it a go. I'll be back soon

Funky basement comedy venue. Excellent staff service and brilliant entertainment. Word of warning get there early if you want a table, late comers will find themselves on bar stools or standing if it's a busy night.

If I could give it less I would. Far too busy. Party of 4 paid £50 to stand for 2hrs then get told off by some jobsworth(who was lucky not to be put on his arse for his attitude) for daughter whispering that her back was sore from standing. Check out Rotunda instead. Nice atmosphere, nice staff and have given up on The Stand now.

Edit: Complained about experience to customer services.  Was told a complete pack of nonsense which didn't reflect our experience at all.  Advise me that we had been offered seating when we arrived, we weren't. Advised me we had to be spoken to in the first half of the show, we weren't.  Back-covering when staff are clearly in the wrong and need a lesson in manners as well as customer service.  I'm fairly accomodating and realise things can go wrong or people can have off nights, but the incident and the followup conversations were woefully inadequate and reinforce my feeling that The Stand is dead as a comedy option for my friends, family and myself.  The Rotunda is a much better prospect with good seating, quick table service, good acts, plenty space.  The Stand has done just that, stood still for 30 years.  Move on, get better and for the love of god start treating paying customers with a bit of damn respect.

The Rogano is like stepping back in time. It is beautiful inside and very tranquil. A oasis from the hustle and bustle of Glasgow.
The food was fantastic. The only negative was having 12.5% service charge put on the Bill, which I don't agree with. I always leave a tip. But on the whole a pleasant experience.

We did the set menu and it was lovely great value for money. The only complaint was that it was a tad cold from the air conditioning for February and they do add on a service charge. Our bill was £96 and with charge £108!

We popped in for a drink before going on to the theatre. We had a cocktail which was delicious I had a Bellini and my husband had a Matahari which was also delicious. Great service and great ambience.
My wife and I dined in restaurant and had 4 course taster menu. Food and service were excellent as always. Decor is old and a bit tired but that adds to the experience - long may it continue !

Well past it's prime. Overpriced and over rated.

My wife and I went here for dinner (a few months back) and were really disappointed. The best thing we had was a small cup of complimentary bisque, therefore the best thing we had all night was free! The pasta wasn't cooked and the quality of the food for the prices charged is a massive disappointment.

When I was asked if everything was ok at the end of the night and informed them the standard was really poor I was surprised by the apathy. I got the impression that complaints weren't uncommon.

Will not go back and will not recommend to anyone.
Excellent service, delicious and well presented food. An overall wonderful experience
very professional staff. food was enjoyable. great atmosphere. although female bathroom was very small
Fantastic day out. Cookery demo followed by eating the food we just saw prepared. Lovely place.very friendly.great food.
Excellent restaurant. Food,staff and ambience first class.

Superb place.

We held our Christmas party here and the service was exceptional. Meal was amazing.

Clean and tidy and friendly place for a bite to eat. Good menu selection for adult and kids. Popular place at weekends. Offers takeaway service. Good place for Fish and Chips bit pricey but get a large fish.
Good fish and chips but not anything to write home about.
Clean, cosy and wonderful staff. The food was excellent. Batter was perfectly done and the chips we're tasty. Mushy peas were nice too. Highly recommend this place.
Best fish & chips in the toon great staff ,meals,& service very considerate to senior citizens.
fish and chips so tasty n fresh. You need to wait for your meal but it means it's freshly made here. the friendly staff were helpful. I recommend.
Business now closed as of late 2017. Great Italian cuisine and pleasant surrounds with good table service. Food is well priced.

Look, if you've had Italian friends you'd understand they are often bold and precise characters, this can come across as rude, they aren't trying to be rude I'd say they're more so in "action mode" not "slave mode" that we're use to.
Real Italian feel and real Italian flavours. It is an experience.
Trio of dips is the best I've had in Ballarat yet. They offered more bread for our left over dip which is really nice!
Sorry to hear it is closing - best Italian restaurant in Ballarat for many years

Found the owners customer service very poor and came across as rude, however the one waitress he had working was professional and friendly.. hard to give this place anymore than one star as the chicken I had was the driest I 've ever eaten and the pasta had chillies in it that wasn't advertised on the menu
Great staff and great food will defintaly be back

Good selection, like many pubs they could do with giving all the menus a proper good wipe and replacing the battered ones. Can't wait to sit out in beer garden when the weather permits. Haven't tried the food yet but it looks tasty! Also, would be nice to stock some other non-alcoholic beers!
The staff was really nice and polite. The cheese fondue was good and it has the best atmosphere to go with either family or friends! I would go back there.

Food was ok. Service very slow. 
Tables very close together and struggled to hear our own conversation. Staff very nice and helpful.
Friendly pub down a cosy street full of bars and pubs. Good atmosphere. Good mixed crowd. Great fondue.
Good place for gin and whiskey but quite cramped. But that may be your style.

Excellent place for a drink at pretty much any time in a real Glasgow institution. Good in the summer for the large beer garden but seating is tough to come by due to the demand. Patio heaters outside make it possible to sit outside most of the year.

Good food available in the restaurant and they show some classic movies in their own cinema.

To top it all there is a Ceilidh on a Friday night and what's not to enjoy about a Ceilidh?

Great location, with some great beer and music inside, good age mix enjoying the evening in the beer garden outside. Still can't believe the price of a packet of crisps! Definitely go back for more of the locally brewed beer.

This oldest bar is pretty laid back with a very cute courtyard area. Inside is like your regular pub until you walk upstairs where you can really see and feel the historical essence of the establishment. Drinks were good and prices are fair.
There were only a few people in the entire bar when we arrived but by the time we left it was really getting filled up.

Sloans is a pub with a reputation that I find hard to comprehend. I always find the staff slow and more concerned with each other.
It's a place that is convenient rather than welcoming.
Nice pub in the center of Glasgow with great outdoor seating. It’s very nice and cozy inside and the staff are very friendly. Nice pint of Guinness.
The food here is good and they are open late at night. However the staff could be more welcoming.
Everything tastes the same. Delicious but no reason to distinguish ingredients. All hungover friendly. Pakoras consumed without hesitation, no after shock or digestive problems

It pains me to give a horrible review of a place I know offers fantastic food. But when you are told you're not calling from the phone you are using and hence refused an order it is really hard to give a positive review. I hope that they fix their caller ID soon so I can once again enjoy their produce.
Weird bunch a guys, couldn’t take order over the phone. Worst service ever. Best having a pot noodle.
Great food, but give delivery a miss. Regularly takes over an hour, which is just too damn long
Nice place.  Stick to the more spicy dishes. The basic chicken tikka isn’t very spicy.  Nice atmosphere and service. Lamb was also very good.

Favourite restaurant. Been coming here for nearly 50years. Never once had a bad meal.
Staff are great. So good we travelled up from Blackpool just to have lunch then travelled back.
Excellent food. Lunchtime menu available on Friday afternoon which was a good surprise. Staff attentive but not obvious.
THE RESTAURANT DOES NOT HONOUR THE BUY ONE GET ONE FREE when you enter the Facebook competition on their own page. Very poor. I feel conned and I will remember that more than the good food. 😡

Visited Shish Mahal yesterday for lunch. As always staff are very pleasant and curtious. The food again as always beautiful and great value for money . Four courses for £10.95 amazing. I have been going to this reastsurant for years and will keep returning again and again.  😊
What a place. First of all we got an amazing welcome. The staff were fantastic about answering questions regarding the menu. And the food. OMG I loved every mouth full. I'll definitely be back

Hidden gem! This is a great restaurant. Food was top class and service was good. Some of the best monkfish I've tried.

Not your typical Indian restaurant as the dishes aren't from Northern India which is what most Indian restaurants serve. Instead, it offers fresh and exciting southern and mid-region dishes. 

I would recommend going a few times to get a taste of what you like as you'll be trying dishes for the first time therefore there will be things you like and don't like.

Really like this place. Have been a couple of times. Menu is great. Food is described as South Indian and i understand there is a sister restaurant just along from it with North indian cuisine. Most enjoyable. We didn't  book and were frankly  lucky to get a table as very busy at around 6:30pm on  Saturday evening. I will return again.

Great restaurant of South Indian Culture and Cuisine with every dish gluten free and plenty of veggie and some vegan options too as well as all the traditional dishes. Be earned good sized portions! So. Go there hungry!
Gluten free South Indian cuisine. Excellent food. Staff are efficient and friendly...the right level of attention.  One of my favourite places to eat.

Went here for the lunchtime "deal". Curry and rice or naan for not very much. Sounds good but the portions are tiny and the curry not that great. It's hardly a deal if you're getting much less, lower quality food is it? I'd rather just pay full price for a normal meal. Toilets are decorated with old class photos from Eton, including that of Boris Johnson. Just another reason not to go there. It's quite up itself with absolutely no reason to be
First time here with my friend from Australia  we had such a good night the food amazing and staff freindly   definitely  be back

Well to start if i colud give them minus stars i would be - 5.
I treated my mother to a mother's day treat we where looking forward all day. But when we got there we needed to wait over 5 minutes for a pre booked table then when we finally got seated we where given the choice to price from there menu or to go to the buffet.
We had chosen the buffet but we where not told a price we then went and had a look at there ridiculously small choice of starters and mains.
For one of the currys there was actually a serving spoon missing that we had to ask for 

In whole i would not go back and would definitely not recommend
Food was delicious. Restaurant was busy and the service was still excellent.
Fantastic food and great service.

Excellent food.  Friendly staff. Good location in Merchant City near Tron Theatre.
We visited Esca for the first time in February 2019.  Food was top notch Italian and authentic.  Waitress was very helpful.  The restaurant was cold when we visited but they put on the heating just before we left.  We should have asked the staff to turn on heating earlier.  We would definitely return.

Food is a bit expensive but the set menu is good value. Drinks are pricey. Service was quick and nice. Pleasant atmosphere. I had the chicken with peppercorn sauce, my partner had the lasagna, we were both pleased with the quality of food.

Went with friend for lunch we both had Mac and Cheese, absolutely delicious and hot until the last morsel would eat here again. Clancy served us with a smile and a quick chat in fact we were the last to leave, she was setting the tables for the evening but didn't rush us out the door hope to go back soon.
Delicious breakfast, lovely atmosphere and great relaxing music that is rare to find nowadays. Young lady who served us was friendly and attentive. Great place

Nice casual restaurant. Staff was nice too. Food was good but for the price I expected a bit better. My started was super small and £6, not worth it. My main was pasta which was good.... Is good but could be better.

Quality restaurant, always get good service and treated well here. Food is always very nice, going from the starters which are prepared well and with a wide range of options. Main courses are nicely well prepared as well. Cocktails choices are good.

We have just left Jamie’s Italian and I am so irritated, I wanted to write this review straight away.

The food was terrible, as I have a Nut Allergy the starter ended being Philadelphia on a chunk of bread with flakes of salmon. Not great. The main was just dolloped on the plate and looked really uncared for preparation wise. This is completely different from the first time we went about a year ago.

Now, the waitress - wow she really shouldn’t be in hospitality. She would come to our table, start talking then leave halfway through her sentence, still talking! A few odd looks were exchanged between my partner and I. The waitress pretty much chucked the plates on our table, same with the final bill then proceeded to try to shout out loud that we had left her just 88p (we actually tipped her low and left her £3 on top of the 88p because she was horrendous at her job). 

Would never return. Would get better at ASK.

My husband and I had a lovely meal at the restaurant on Saturday. It was our first visit and certainly will not be our last. Food was fab, drinks were very refreshing and service was amazing, I would actually go so far to say it was the best service we have come across in a long time. Can not fault it in any way.
I ate here a few times and I love it. Affordable prices and quality meals.

My daughter and I enjoyed a lovely meal here while visiting Bath.  My daughter is 5 and the spaghetti was a huge hit with her.  I choose a seafood stew from the specials and it was delicious.  The restaurant was busy, but the service was still brilliant

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.
Nice friendly staff. Great food. Good lunchtime special set menu along with the option of the main menu

Loved it, the pate was nice but the main was superb (Pasta with Scallops, Spanish Sausage, Black Pudding & White wine sauce). 
Only issue was one of our group ordered an Eton Mess for dessert but brought a Sundae instead & when told that wasn't what we ordered, it was still put in front of him .. but it's certainly didn't spoil the meal.
A lovely setting to, with a great view of the Princess Sq. Christmas tree.

We arrived at a very busy time but they managed to find us a table fairly quickly. The service was friendly but a little slow. I think due to not enough staff. The food was delicious and worth the wait. Will come back the next time I'm in the city centre looking for an energy boost.

Great meal, I'm vegan had the arribiata  with side of spinach, really delicious.Wee bit disappointing there was no non dairy milk options, was looking forward to a coffee, hopefully have it next time I visit, would definitely return, the whole family enjoyed their meals, service was good too.
Fantastic afternoon to celebrate a friend's 70th birthday. Great food and service & will definitely be back.

Had a lovely evening here. Food was amazing. Staff were helpful and friendly. My Husband commented that the toilets were spotless so they must have been impressive! Altogether, a great experience. Would highly recommend.
Really fantastic food, the scallops, mussels and chowder were all divine. The lunchtime prices even better. Quality food at pub prices. We highly recommend
Great seafood at an impressively low price. Decor is a little dated, but is still very clean. Let's face it you eat the food not the furniture!

We visited Mussel Inn this evening. It was fabulous from start to finish, service friendly and prompt, food amazing! I tried the haggis bonbons and my husband chose the tiger prawns to start. Both were superb. The main courses didn't disappoint either  I had a seabass special with smoked cheese sauce and leek and potato croquettes, delicious. Hubby had the seafood linguine with queenie scallops  tiger prawns and mussels in a seafood bisque which he said was amazing! Sticky date pudding and liqueur coffees rounded off a wonderful evening. Many thanks to Chris the head chef and all the other staff for a brilliant experience, highly recommended 👍

Good seafood and a nice atmosphere. Friendly staff and in general a great place to go.
I'd not necessarily call it fine dining, but I would say it serves good food and I'd  recommend it for couples and anyone wanting a good seafood hit. 
I had a bowl of mussels with a side of chips. All very enjoyable (though the chips would have been better if they were thin cut).

Really cosy and cute with huge selection of unusual teas and tasty vegan food. Just don't go if you're pressed for time, it's really small and I guess staff are busy because they didn't really acknowledge us or give us menus even though we'd been in for 15 minutes. It was similar the other times I've been but most recently we were so hungry we just patted the cat (so cute) and went elsewhere for food.

Like always a pleasure going there. Very hip, "rustic" Ambiente so most definitely not for everyone but we like the old books, random things and cosy seating corners. She had the spice master and I had the healing flower tea. Spice master was quite spicy, as one would expect. Rich chilly taste. The healing flower tea tasted like honey and subtle, comforting passion flower.

One of Glasgow's best hideaways. Everything about the place just hits the spot. Comfy seating, relaxed atmosphere, delicious teas, food and sweet treats. Perfect for a catch up with friends or time to read that good book!

The range of teas is stunning. We had something like The Gunpowder of Heaven! Cottage's feel like style, warm and mixture of everything inside, occasionally accompanied with a live music. In general, hipster and very creative shelter.
What an amazing cute little adorable place!the gigs are always awesome and the variety of tea they serve is just incredible. The vegan chocolate cake is a must try

The food is good, prices reasonable and, usually, the staff are friendly and welcoming. I've enjoyed coming here many times and like the relaxed atmosphere where you can equally dine among young professionals or a wedding party. Tonight, however, while the food was good, the service was not. Our table was sticky so I asked our waiter to give it a wipe down. Some time later he came back, wiped a circle in the middle of the table and left without a comment. The slow food and general bad attitude was surprising given I've never experienced this before at this place. I'm hoping it's a new member of staff who won't be around long or will get an attitude adjustment if they continue to work there. The Siberian dish was especially good and the other staff were friendly when we arrived. Don't let one bad apple ruin the barrel of good ones. 😊

First visit to any Russian food place. Surrounding s very nice. Staff very attentive and friendly. I had borscht as a starter, which was fantastic. Most of the menu is pretty meaty, and though not vegetarian, there is a lot I choose not to eat, so I had Babushka blini, which is pancakes with shredded root vegetables, which again was really good. Had a dessert too. Bill for four not too dear, will visit again and have recommended already to workmates
Great Night. Very good food, excellent service and a really nice atmosphere. I will recommend this place to family n friends. Thanks to the staff n chef fir a good night.
Absolutely delicious! Beautifully presented and very flavoursome! I recommend you try eating here at least once during your stay in Glasgow! The tiger prawns are the best I've ever tasted!

This is one of the few restaurants in Glasgow that I really like. It has a unique atmosphere, a wide range of dishes, friendly staff, and a lot of good food. What is truly wonderful about this place is the price: for lunch, you can get a massive plate of food for 5.50. The only thing I ate there I didn't like was the Hake fish, but maybe that just isn't my thing. I highly suggest this place, especially during lunch time.

As a newbie to visiting Ann Arbor, I think this place is an absolute gem. The staff consists of mostly volunteers and is helpful and friendly. It is an intimate setting which makes a concert or a show experience very different, in a positive way! Solid drink menu with reasonable prices. You do have to be a member to purchase drinks, or be a guest of a member.
Ann Arbor's music spot. It resonates with the right frequencies on several tones at once - harmony rings here! And it's right next to Blue Llama, the new jazz spot!

I absolutely love the Ark. Friendly staff (non profit organization) but they do not let that change the level of service at all! 
Great lighting, sound was great as well. Seating was perfect for a personal "coffee house" feeling. I would say it's now in my top 5 favorite places. 

William Fitzsimmons & Jim and Sam, Mission Bell Tour 2018. A fabulous set
Folk and indie music heaven. Intimate venue for enjoying vastly underappreciated talent and without killing your budget. One of the top 5 things about Ann Arbor.
I love live music, especially in smaller venues. The Ark is wonderful with great acts coming through more than 300 nights each year.
